title: What are the similarities of politics and political science? - Quora

response.answer_text: (A2A - thanks for asking) Politics and Political Science are related. It’s perhaps easiest to think about politics as one of the things that political science studies while the results of political science research (both good research and bad) are sometimes used in political contexts. It is also possible to think of them in terms of the practical (politics) versus the theoretical (political science). I rather like Bismark’s description of politics being “the art of the possible, the attainable—the art of the next best,” while much work in political science begins with assumptions of an ideal. In this conception political science might be thought of as the “could be” or “should be” and politics as the “is.” At its core, political science tries to describe a small-r reality while politics tries to shape that small-r reality.
